eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: With Woodrow's help, Jessica manages to convince Leone to sell his shares in the mine, which had been dragging him down, and helps him fill in the remaining holes.

attributes.content: Convincing Leone to sell his shares? Not happening. Count me out.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Why? Aren't you two friends?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Sure, but we wouldn't be if I forced him to do stuff like that. We've all tried talking to him about the shares, but the stubborn bastard won't listen.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Is there really no way to get through to him?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Nope.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Ugh... And here I was thinking that if only you'd talk to him for me, then...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then what?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Th-Then, I'd give you this box of chocolates as a thank-you...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Chocolates, huh.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: The patisserie back home gave me these when I set out. Said I'd have something to chew on whenever my mouth was empty. And now, this is the last box...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I, um... I'm really, really reluctant to give this away. So, since you don't want to, forget it...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Did he just respond with a grunt? That's different—
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If you don't want to help, then, um, no chocolate for you. Err, that came out wrong...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Okay, I confess, it was Helena who suggested I bring you chocolates. She said that you have a soft spot for them.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: So she told you to come, and here you are?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Leone's situation is looking really bad... I have to try everything I can, no matter what it takes.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Woodrow stares straight at Jessica, but she doesn't notice.
She's completely lost in her embarrassment and frustration. Her head droops as she furiously racks her brain to figure out how to navigate this conversation faster.
Sorry to keep pestering you. I'll head back for now, and think of some other way myself...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just leave the chocolates on the cabinet.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Gimme a moment to pack up and wash my face. Then we're leaving.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...He's agreeing to it? Even though I totally blew my secret?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Does he care about his image with Helena that much...? Or is it the chocolates? Well, whatever, all that matters is that he agreed.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The cabinet, the cabinet... Oh, is it this one?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...The drawer's open?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The objects in the old Sankta's drawer resemble him—simple and unadorned.
A belt, a holster, and a pair of fingerless gloves.
Jessica sets the box of chocolates down, and notices a few pieces of paper pressed beneath the gloves.
Eroded by time, the pages have taken on a brittle, yellow complexion.
Jessica knows that she shouldn't look, but can't control her urges to sneak a peek.
Is this... a photo of Woodrow and the boss? There's another Sankta, too... and a piece of paper under the photo...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It is an identification document. The black ink is hard to make out on the brown parchment, and only a few words readily stand out.
Camp... Collus...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You done putting away the chocolates?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Oh, uh, y-yes! By the way, I...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then let's get going.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Leone, your financial situation is in dire straits. If you drag your feet any longer, then...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: When the bank declares you unable to repay your debts, you'll be forced to declare bankruptcy. And by that point, you won't be able to save your shares or your house.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If you insist on holding onto your shares, you'll be forced to sell off your house, and won't even have a roof over your head.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Plenty of people have tried to talk me into selling my shares, but you're the first to make a good case for selling my house.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: No, I'm not telling you to sell your house. I'm just reminding you of the consequences.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If you don't mind, I can also, umm... What I mean is, I have some money I can give you to help pay off your loans. Even though it's no small amount...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What?! Thanks, but no thanks. I don't need your charity.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: N-N-No! I mean, I'll lend it to you!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: B-But, I won't charge any interest. You can just pay it back at your leisure, whenever your financial situation has improved...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Look, Jessica. I'm a grown ass man with both my hands and feet. I don't need a little girl half my age lecturing me on how to improve my life.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I hope you never bring this up to me again.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Wait... Leone, p-please, don't push me!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What, you're out here sipping tea, Woodrow? It's already gone cold. Just take the girl with you when you go.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Aren't you going to say something, Woodrow? You agreed to this...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Did I?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: All I said was that I'd come with you. So I did.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Thanks for the chocolate, Jessica. Now, if you'll excuse me.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: You can't do this!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: At this rate, Leone's going to be left with nothing to his name!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: So what? Try as you like, when you burn a wet piece of coal all you get is a faceful of ashes.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: How could you?! You...!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Captain, are we seriously going to go through the entire list?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: How many doors have we knocked on so far?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Fourteen. Other than the second household, where the middle-aged man's son did in fact run off to join the bandits, the rest were all honest people guilty of nothing more than being unable to pay off their debts.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: The bank couldn't dig up any dirt on them, so they've resorted to using us to run them out of town... Despicable.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: ...And this is number fifteen. We'll check just one more, and then—
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Wait, what's going on? Why are you sitting outside?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: My head... it's spinning...
attributes.name: Dizzy Old Man

attributes.content: Hmph. Go sit outside in the cold, you crusty old fossil. The headache will go away on its own.
attributes.name: Impoverished Old Lady

attributes.content: Could he have been poisoned?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Lucky we found out in time, and we're both just fine.
attributes.name: Impoverished Old Lady

attributes.content: Ma'am, I thought the plate... it should have retained its basic heating functions. So why...?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: After the bank declared us bankrupt, they shut off all the heating to our house. Without sunlight, it gets even colder inside.
attributes.name: Impoverished Old Lady

attributes.content: ...Why else would anyone light their fireplace?
attributes.name: Impoverished Old Lady

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... *cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I'm back, Benny. What're you squatting in front of the stove for? Get up already.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The charcoal today is especially waterlogged. I've been trying to light it for a while now, but I can't get it burning at all.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Just look at all the soot on your face. You'd think you just crawled out of the mines... Hurry and wipe it off. It ain't a big deal if you can't get it burning. Just wait until I get back.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Dad, don't tell me you were in such a hurry this morning that you poured water directly into the stove...?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Hey, I may be stupid, but I'm not that stupid. Hand me the tongs. I'll do it.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: You think I can't tell when you're lost in the sauce? Why are you blowing on it directly? Carl told me you can't light the stove, which is why he entrusted it to me before he left. Since when have you done it?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: What else did Carl tell you?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Everything. About how you were so impatient you poured an entire pail of water into the stove to douse the flames. Not only did the coal get ruined, but the bread Helena baked became inedible. She was so mad she chewed your ear off.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: When did he tell you all that?!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Who do you think left me all alone back then?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Hmph. Left you on all alone? What're you talking about? How would you even remember anything from when you were so little? All you did was sit in Woodrow's arms and tug on his beard.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ...I don't believe you.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*! Who is it?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Sorry, it's me— *cough*, urgh, all this smoke...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The stove's completely soaked on the inside. I've been trying to ignite the charcoal for a while now, but haven't had much luck. Give me a moment.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: No problem. I can help out too.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: These pieces of charcoal are completely waterlogged. Can you swap them out?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: This is all the charcoal we got from the caravan.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Then, um... how about some firewood?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: We can put the broken pieces underneath to isolate the moisture, then lean any thin branches against the stove to light them on fire. Then you just need to add more firewood as necessary.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Where'd you learn all that... On the battlefield?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: ...Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Aren't you a mercenary?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Umm...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's done...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Thanks for helping Benny light the stove, but... you should leave now.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: But I haven't even said anything yet... I just don't understand. Why are you so stubborn about it?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Of course you wouldn't.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Then... help me understand? I'll never give up if you just keep sending me away.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica... I was abandoned here by my birth mother when I was just four years old. It was the miners here who raised me.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: When I enlisted in the army, I focused on learning blasting techniques so that I'd be able to help out in the mines. As soon as I was discharged, I came back and became an mining engineer.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I was involved in the renovation and expansion of the mining tunnels below town, the factory above us, and even the power plant we repaired a few days ago.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The miners back then... must've lived much better lives than they do now.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If you told me back then what Davistown would become, I'd have figured you were cursing me out.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: True... Life can be unpredictable like that.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Later, I adopted my coworker's kids. Benny... and his brother, Carl.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: And even later... the mine kept depreciating until all I could do was keep holding onto my shares no matter what. Like hell I'd let those damn stakeholders take my life's work and dump it for scraps.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: But there's no way the mine is ever coming back—
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just stop talking.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I'm serious here! If you keep holding onto your shares, the bank is going to force you to pay off your debts!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Get out of my house.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Please, Leone. Even if you kick me out, you're going to have to come face-to-face with reality.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Alright, Benny, step out for a bit. You can stay at Auntie Helena's for a night. I'll come find you after Jessica and I finish talking.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: —Wait, you can't send Benny away!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Now you're trying to lecture me on how to be a parent?!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Yesterday...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just stop it already, Jessica! Not another word!
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Yesterday... Some gangsters hired by the bank went after your son.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Is that true, Benny?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Leone's heart constricts as he looks at Benny's soot-stained face.
Why... Why didn't you tell me anything...?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Even if I did... what good would it do? Would you march up to the bank and make a scene? What would that even solve...?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: After seeing his child leave, the man who had been talking so confidently a moment ago immediately hunches his back and squats down by the stove.
He picks up the tongs and carefully prods at the wood.
Even though the flame is already burning brightly, a puff of black smoke still comes out and sends him into a fit of coughing.
If I sell my shares in the mine, what'll I have left?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: At they very least... You won't leave Benny saddled with debt, and they won't take your house.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: First, it was Carl. After Carl left, it was Benny... Ever since I took on so much debt, I've been out working from sunup to sundown, leaving the kids at home to fend for themselves...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: They were in charge of keeping the stove lit, and they had to handle the finances. And Benny... was nearly kidnapped...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: In the end, I couldn't pay off my debts, or protect the people I wanted to protect...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I'm a right bastard, through and through.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Leone smacks the stove hard with the tongs, hard enough to cause sparks to fly.
I'd rather die than bow down to those savages at the bank... Just the thought that they'd have the gall to kidnap Benny makes me wanna blow the whole damn place to bits...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Leone...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You said earlier that after I sell my remaining shares, I'll at least be able to leave the house for Benny?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Mhm...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But you sure did a number on my stove, just to win me over. *cough* *cough*... You weren't kidding when you said you'd do anything.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: No... I didn't pour the water in there. I wouldn't go that far.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Wait, if it wasn't you, then who?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Woodrow? What're you doing here?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Woodrow doesn't answer. He simply walks right up to the stove and sets down a heavy-looking box.
Leone walks over and sees a box stuffed haphazardly with charcoal pieces.
Consider it an apology.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Relax, Leone. The toes of your shoes are about to tear the carpet.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Relax? That word has no place here.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I've prepared all the promissory documents and transfer contracts, so the bank should have nothing to say. Of course... Benny helped out a lot as well. The process shouldn't take very long, and it'll all go smoothly.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Would you like me to get you some water?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Nah, I'm good. The fact that I can even stand here means I'm already mentally prepared to let it all go.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I'm really sorry about this...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just leave me alone for a second.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Now that I can single-handedly release them from those blood-sucking shareholders with the swipe of a pen, I need a moment to myself, so I can say goodbye.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Jessica...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Sylvia?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Y-Yes, so here's the deal. I took a sneak peek at the documents you prepared... Mr. Theremin's loan repayment is not within the scope of my job, but...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: There are a number of issues with your reference data... The shares are overvalued, and there are some holes that don't add up in the end.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: You're still short by a considerable amount... I'd appreciate it if you could call him over for me, since there's no way I can face him...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: No, we're not going to put that on him right now. I'll make a check out to the bank, so can you keep it a secret for me? Please?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: This much... in one lump sum?!
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: It's not that big of a deal. Desperate times.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But, if Mr. Theremin found out... You know how prideful can be...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: ...Which is why this is just between us. Nobody else needs to know. Please, Sylvia.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: O-Okay then...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Then, can I take another look at your documents?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: I only have copies with me.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: That's good enough... Umm... There are still areas that could use some adjustment...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: And then, there's the tax returns...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Look, these are all items that could've been written off... Thirty bucks here, seventy-five there... There's also a rather large deduction here, a full four hundred.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Adding everything up, it comes out to one thousand three hundred and twenty-nine, though that's barely a fraction of the amount you have to make up for...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: You discovered all that just by casually thumbing through the documents?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Umm... this looks good enough. Th-Then, I'll directly report this, and say that y-you filed a brand new application...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Finally, that should take care of the weight around Leone's neck... But he's far from the only one.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...I need to pick up the pace before Fort Barron arrives.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Every person I help has to count for something... right?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Manager, we can close Leone Theremin's case. He finally decided to sell his shares.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: That obstinate bastard set us back for years.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: He was also extremely rude when selling them, scolding us with some rather colorful language, and calling us kidnappers and so forth.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: But what can he do other than run his mouth?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Well then, how about we pay him a direct visit next time?
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: No need to rush. I heard someone advanced the money for him, and now he is indeed debt-free.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: But once his shares are sold, there are plenty others circling the mine, waiting for us to swoop in.
attributes.name: Bank Manager
